newsitem.title: USA: Fleet to buy Columbia Management- USA Today.
newsitem.headline: Fleet to buy Columbia Management- USA Today.

text.p: Fleet Financial Group Inc has agreed to buy privately held mutual fund company Columbia Management for between $500 million and $600 million in cash, USA Today reported Wednesday.
Officials from both Fleet and Columbia Management, which is based in Portland, Ore, were not immediately available to comment.
Both companies declined to comment Tuesday, USA Today reported.
The paper also said Fleet's board approved the deal -- which may be announced today -- earlier in the week.
Columbia has $22 billion in assets under management, the paper said, putting Fleet's purchase price just under 3 percent of those assets.

The acquisition would propel Fleet from 62nd to about 40th in the asset manegement industry, the paper said, citing Pensions & Investments magazine. It would also double the size of the company's asset manegement arm -- Fleet Investment Advisors -- which oversees about $50 billion in assets.
The acquisition would also be in line with Fleet's plan to expand beyond its traditional core-lending business, the paper said.
